title: Junior Database Administrator
description:
Scion Staffing (www.scionstaffing.com), the Bay Area’s leading nonprofit staffing specialist, has been engaged to find an attention-detailed Junior Database Analyst for the California Nurses Association/ National Nurses Organizing Committee. This position is for immediate hire.

OVERVIEW:

This role is a temporary position managing our SQL Server databases, which includes development, test and production environments for our various enterprise and external web applications. Additional duties will include working with several departments to add system functionality, tables, and data; optimizing systems for availability and performance; and contributing to system upgrades. The Database Administrator also is responsible for maintaining applications, processes, and maintenance procedures; performance tuning; and documentation and management of changes to database operations.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

 Setup, configure, and install database systems located in virtual environments both on-premises and in the cloud (Azure).
 Optimizes and tunes database systems.
 Proactively monitors performance and capacity.
 Performs data ports and data loads; monitors and tests data integrity as required.
 Backup, recovery, testing of recovery procedures, and archiving databases.
 Troubleshoots database issues and performs database impact analysis for proposed changes.
 Ensures that systems stay updated on all relevant patches and upgrades.
 Alter tables and schema structure as required.
 Works with the application development teams to develop stored procedures, triggers and code to support enterprise applications as well as to enforce coding standards.
 Executes database release management processes and coordinates maintenance of development, testing, and production environments.
 Deploy database change scripts provided by third party vendors.
 Automates manual processes when practical.
 Maintains quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.
 Document the company’s database environment.
TO BE SUCCESFUL: 

Must be able to work within our office, no remote candidates.
2+ years Microsoft (MS) SQL Server experience.
2+ years of overall database administration experience (development or production environments, any RDBMS).
2+ years of production MS SQL Server administration experience.
2+ years of experience with Windows server, including Active Directory.
Strong technical and analytical and problem solving skills to troubleshoot root cause of database related issues.
Working knowledge using ANSI SQL with Transact-SQL (T-SQL) preferred.
Experience in data-cleansing and validation of data integrity.
Analysis Services (SSAS), Integration Services (SSIS), or Reporting Services (SSRS).
Failover clustering, SAN replication, and other high availability technologies.
Writing T-SQL from scratch.
Experience using SSIS and other ETL tools to automate data import and processing.
Experience with Azure cloud hosting environments.
SALARY:
This position offers a competitive salary of $45+ hourly, DOE.

HOW TO APPLY:
For immediate consideration, please submit your resume as a Word (.doc) or (.docx) attachment to https://www.scionstaffing.com/jobportal/#/jobs/5407. Or submit your resume by responding directly to this add.

ABOUT OUR SEARCH FIRM:
Scion Staffing is an award winning staffing firm headquartered in San Francisco, CA. Over the past few years, our firm has had the pleasure of successfully assisting hundreds of local employers. No matter the requisition or size, our track record and recruitment process has made us one of the top recruitment firms in California. title: R&D Test Operator, Overnight
description:
We're the driverless car company.

We believe in improving people's lives by making transportation safer, more accessible, and more convenient. We're building the world's most advanced software to fuel the driverless cars that safely connect people to the places, things, and experiences they care about.

We seek and embrace diversity in all of its forms. We continuously push ourselves to think differently and take ownership wherever it's needed. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed. If you share our passion for achieving what some say is impossible, join us.

About the Role: 
We are hiring Vehicle Test Operators to help us test and improve the performance of our autonomous vehicles! You should have a knack for fixing things and work well under pressure. Navigating a computer should be second nature to you. Ideal candidates will have an impeccable driving record and excellent driving skills. We're looking for qualified candidates to join us in a contract position starting immediately. The contract is expected to last a year and possibly longer. 

Schedule:
Sunday - Thursday
11:45pm - 7:45am
40 hr/week
$23/hr with growth opportunities

**Apply at https://getcruise.com/ and search for "R&D Test Operator, Overnight"**

Day-to-day responsibilities include:
- Ensure the safety of vehicles while in both autonomous and manual mode while operating the autonomous vehicle (AV)
- Log vehicle behavior and monitor vehicle software as the AV passenger
- Test the newest AV code and consistently deliver high-quality feedback to engineers
- Troubleshoot AV software in varied and dynamic environments
- Identify abnormal AV behaviors and escalate them through the proper channels
- Validate the performance of new and existing hardware including sensors and new vehicle platforms 
- Develop creative solutions to execute tests and improve operations
- Provide exceptional ride demonstrations to employees and guests of Cruise
- Remain well informed of all changes to vehicle behavior and tools
- Become a leader and train new operators
- Hold yourself and others accountable for maintaining our "Stay Safe" culture
- Perform special projects as requested by various Cruise teams
- Keep project details confidential 

You should apply for this role if you have the following qualifications:
- Ability to thoroughly diagnose and troubleshoot basic software issues
- Typing speed of over 50 words per minute
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Licensed to drive a motor vehicle in the U.S. for the three years immediately preceding your application and currently hold an active California driver's license
- No more than 1-point on driving record and excellent driving skills
- Clean background check and drug screen
-Must safely operate the vehicle in accordance with Cruise safety protocols and applicable law.  This includes, but is not limited to, having a sufficient range of motion to turn a steering wheel, safely operating the accelerator and brake, checking blind spots and evaluating the environment, and maintaining appropriate airbag clearance.
-Ability to tolerate physical jolts and high-speed starts, stops, turns, and maneuvers associated with driving or taking control of the autonomous vehicle in both training and daily job functions
-Capability to perform physical work including, but not limited to, bending, stooping, and various operational tasks
-Work effectively and professionally in a stressful environment, including interactions with the public
-Capacity to remain alert and extremely focused for two-hour uninterrupted blocks of time
-Must satisfy the legal requirements to become an Operator (13 CCR § 227.34)


Bonus Points:
- 3+ years previous work experience
- Bachelor's degree (or relevant QA / Operations experience)
- Prior AV experience
- Military, Content Review, Technician, EMT experience
- Defensive drivers training (Smith Systems, etc.)
- Route/Delivery experience

Perks:
- Catered lunch, snacks, etc.
- The opportunity to solve difficult problems that have immediate and valuable real-world applications
- Applied product testing in real life situations

**Apply at https://getcruise.com/ and search for "R&D Test Operator, Overnight"**

This position is full-time employment with our contingent workforce partner, paying $23/hour and offering benefits, 401(k), and paid time off.

title: Software Engineer - Venture Backed Startup
description:
Are you interested in mapping the inside of every building on the planet? So are we!

title: Operations Manager @ AI Food Tech Company
description:
Operations Manager

The Markov Corporation is an AI food tech company based in Palo Alto, CA that is redefining how we eat at work. We’re on a mission to transform the office pantry by enabling fresh, on-site cooking of hot and healthy meals, 24/7. The days of protein bars, bags of chips and unhealthy snacks are history!  Say hello to the Level Hot Pantry.

We work with the finest purveyors to source local, high-quality ingredients for our tapas-style, mix and match meals. Whether you’ve assembled a bite, a snack or a meal from our delicious menu, the patented Level oven can “see” your food & automagically cook multiple foods to different temperatures, all at the same time (for example cooking Roasted Rosemary Chicken to 165°F and Seasonal Squash to 185°F)!

We are looking for an Operations Manager to join our team and help us build the most delicious experience in AI! For more, check us out at levelhotpantry.com.

What drives you?
Are you detail oriented and love ensuring every aspect of a customer implementation is executed properly?  
Are you driven by examining processes, taking them apart and rebuilding them for 10X efficiency and maximum impact?
Do you get energy from wearing different hats, stretching yourself and taking on new challenges at every stage to meet customer needs?
Do you enjoy listening to customer feedback, extracting insights and bringing feature enhancement concepts back to the team?  
Do you love the intersection of AI software, hardware and food?

If you are shouting “Yes!” to these questions, then this role is for you.

Responsibilities
Implement menu changes: Partner with our Culinary team to deploy weekly menus to our customers, including setting and executing on a rollout calendar, managing customer orders, updating on-device menu changes and releasing new marketing materials and customer communications related to menu changes.
Customer Support - Provide an enjoyable and empathetically human customer experience, including answering customer calls, troubleshooting, managing billing and recording payments.
Logistics deployment - Install the Level Hot Pantry in our customers’ offices and help manage our hardware inventory.
Managing vendors operations - Work with our vendor operations teams to ensure smooth execution & top-tier customer interactions in all customer touch points, including delivery routing, customer order fulfillment and vendor training.

Requirements
4 year college degree or more
2+ years work experience in one or more of the following areas: customer facing, customer support, account management, operations, logistics, warehouse, or manufacturing environment.
Must have work authorization (no visa sponsorship available)
You must be able to lift 60 lbs.
You must have a valid driver’s license. Driving to our customer offices to install our devices and develop our customer relationships is an important part of this role.

Work Location
This operational role requires hands-on work with our products and close collaboration with the team in our Palo Alto office. Working remotely is not possible.

Compensation
Excellent benefits including: Health, Dental, 401K, Level Hot Pantry Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, Snacks and Kombucha (if that’s your thing!)
Range: $75K - $100K depending on experience
Equity: .01-.05%

Other important details
Markov is an equal opportunity employer.

description:
JRI, a major market research firm is looking for Web Developers and Mobile Application Developers for a market research study.

Our study is a two part paid, online discussion board moderated by a professional researcher.  Our research will take place over a 2–day period starting March 25th- March 27th and going through (April 8th – April 9th, 2019).  At the conclusion of the Online discussion (Part I) there will be a 3-5 day break then there will be a follow-up OBB.  We would like you to participate in both phases of the research. Total $425.00 You must complete Part I & Part II to get paid. If you just complete Part I you will not be paid.

To join in, you’ll need to have access to a computer with high speed internet access.

An online discussion board is a research technique we use to elicit the thoughts and opinions of a group of individuals who have something in common—in this case, all participants will be fellow developers. The discussion will be conducted at a password-protected website over a period of 4 days. If you take part, we’d ask that you visit the website about twice a day at your convenience—the board is open 24-7—to answer questions posted by the discussion leader.

Be assured that at no point will anyone attempt to sell you anything, nor would you ever be contacted for any type of sales as a result of your participation. We’re interested only in what you have to tell us.

If you would like to participate please click on the link below and answer our questionnaire. If you qualify for our research someone from out recruiting team will get back to you and will confirm your participation.

Here is the link:  http://www.datajr.com/v/4B0C5679-34C8-40AC-8060DA51DE9199A0

Thank you in advance for your interest in our research.

title: Embedded Systems Engineer
description:
Palletechnology Inc seeks Embedded Systems Engineer in San Francisco, CA.

Responsibilities: Responsible for designing low-power radiofrequency hardware for Palletech's embedded systems including a pallet sensing and tracking device, and developing reliable low-level embedded microcontroller software. Creates environmental sensor data logging, long-range radio communication and low-power duty cycling functions to achieve the best range, battery life and sensing capability. Develops applications and scripts for the company's Linux-based gateways as part of the design and support of the company's networking infrastructure. Uses test equipment and develops internal tools to measure and verify the company's smart module performance and reliability during prototyping and production phases. Collaborates with backend and other engineers to participate in the design of Palletech's cloud and network architecture, establishes and oversees relationships with electronic components vendors and contract manufacturers for mass production, documenting the product design as a reference for future maintenance and upgrades. Other duties as assigned.

Education: Master’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Engineering (any), or a related technical field.  

Requirements: 2 years of experience in the job offered or related positions. Other special requirements: 2 years of experience designing hardware for battery-powered space-constrained ultra-low power embedded systems featuring microcontrollers, radiofrequency transceivers, sensors, memory, battery and power management, including use of PCB CAD tools for schematic capture and layout design; 2 years of experience working with antennas, including selecting reference designs and implementing on printed circuit boards, performing impedance matching using vector network analyzer and output power and sensitivity measurements to validate radio performance; 2 years of experience developing real-time microcontroller firmware in C, including custom radiofrequency protocol layers, security features, drivers using MCU peripherals (SPI, I2C, UART), and using program and debug tools with JTAG and/or SWD protocols; 2 years of experience working with and designing software for embedded Linux platforms, including cross-compiling applications, generating custom distributions, writing initialization scripts and configuring network layers; and 2 years of experience designing test benches and developing custom testing and validation software tools using Python or Matlab and performing board bring-up and debug, including hand-soldering, rework, and using multimeter, oscilloscope, spectrum analyzer, and logic analyzer.

Please mail resume to Palletech, Attn. R. Linkesch, 465 10th St. #201, San Francisco, CA 94103 quoting job #PTESE19.

title: Enterprise IT Architect (Infrastructure)
description:
Sierra Cybernetics is seeking an Enterprise IT Architect (Infrastructure) to work for us at our government client’s office in downtown San Francisco.  This is expected to be a three year assignment.

Project Title:	Key Person to provide Infrastructure Enterprise Architecture support for the successful attainment of the client’s enterprise strategy.

Summary of Work	The Infrastructure Enterprise IT Architect consults, researches, and evaluates technical solutions to support the successful attainment of the client’s enterprise strategy.  
The mission of the EA program is to facilitate business and IT alignment by creating, communicating and improving the key principles and models that describe the client’s future state and enable its evolution. As new technologies are contemplated for adoption to support mission critical applications, an Enterprise Architect is required to help ensure the technologies are appropriate for the business requirements, compatible with existing infrastructure and that technologies are deployed in an optimal configuration. 

Minimum Job-Specific Skills/Qualifications Required (in order of relative importance):	
•	10+ years as serving in an Enterprise, Solutions or Infrastructure Architect capacity with extensive experience in designing distributed enterprise-level architectures for mission-critical systems.
•	7+ years experience with the type of system infrastructure environment used by the client’s staff, specifically: UNIX/Java/WebLogic Application Server/Oracle database. 
•	Ability to provide solutions in an environment involving multiple datacenters: an in-house datacenter, colo datacenter, hosted datacenter, Software as a Service and a future Cloud datacenter.
•	Experience in managing architects, programmers, analysts and testers in a variety of small to large-scale projects.
•	Experience in large-scale web application architecture, design, development, deployment and operations in a complex deployment environment.
•	Strong system analysis skills, experienced across the complete project lifecycle.
•	Experienced developing the technology solution requirements for customer request for proposals.
•	Familiarity with virtualization technologies
•	Strong communications skills, having the ability to communicate well with all levels of staff -- both technical staff and executive management.
•	Experience developing consensus with disparate groups, sometimes with competing agenda.
•	Experience developing enterprise technical policies for management consideration. 
•	Private as well as pubic-sector experience, preferably in state government.

Additional Skills/Qualifications Desired:	
•	Experience with cloud technologies and cloud vendors
•	Experience with migrating data centers from hosted data centers to cloud providers
•	Experience developing cloud hosting requirements for organizations migrating to the cloud
•	AWS or Azure solutions architect certification is a plus
compensation: compensation based on experience and education.  May be 1099, W-2, or C2C

title: Looking for Full-stack Engineer to join as Employee #1 or Co-Founder
description:
We are a Bay Area startup (still in stealth mode) building a platform to democratize our legal system.  Too much of our legal system--including the forms we use for transacting even the most basic legal transactions--is fragmented and protected by artificial moats. title: Software Engineer
description:
Are you interested in making a world of difference in cancer care?

Cancer strikes more than 10 million people worldwide each year. As the leading medical society representing doctors who care for people with cancer, the American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) is committed to conquering cancer through research, education, and promotion of the highest quality patient care.

Who we are:

ASCO is a stable, forward-thinking membership organization that operates in a results-oriented work environment in which employees’ evaluation emphasizes performance outcomes over presence or time. This is a San Francisco, CA position that offers an excellent benefits package and opportunities to participate in professional development programs. To learn what it’s like to work at ASCO, visit www.asco.org/jobs. 

Who we are looking for:
ASCO (American Society of Clinical Oncology) has embarked on a pioneering effort to develop a learning healthcare system in oncology. This system, CancerLinQ, (www.cancerlinq.org) aggregates data from the day to day care of cancer patients to improve the quality of care and improve health outcomes of all patients with cancer. We are looking for a smart and talented Software Engineer to join us in our fight against cancer. This position is based in San Francisco, CA or Alexandria, VA.

Responsibilities:
•	A hands-on software development role within a small development team
•	Work with other technical members and partners to deliver on the vision of CancerLinQ
•	Work with the Products team to define requirements and then translate those requirements into well designed software components along with unit tests
•	Develop key components of the data pipeline that brings in clinical data about patients from the practice into CancerLinQ
•	Ensure the highest level of quality in all the software that is delivered
•	Document and communicate with technical and non-technical audiences
•	Ensure security and scalability of the platform with sound design principles as the data volumes grow

Requirements:
•	Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent educational background
•	3+ years of software development experience
•	Very good hands-on knowledge of Python, Java, Javascript, Scala, and other programming languages
•	Exposure to scalable “big data” platforms using AWS S3, Redshift, and Apache Spark
•	Experience with Agile development methodologies and tools like git and JIRA
•	Experience with tools and techniques for data transformation, ETL, data normalization, and standardization of clinical data
•	Exposure to data standards in Healthcare IT like HL7, CDA, CCD, RxNorm, LOINC, ICD 10 will be nice to have

ASCO is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)

A firm that runs like a software  company.

- Ensure the safety of vehicles while in both autonomous and manual mode while operating the autonomous vehicle (AV)
- Log vehicle behavior and monitor vehicle software as the AV passenger
- Test the newest AV code and consistently deliver high-quality feedback to engineers
- Troubleshoot AV software in varied and dynamic environments
- Identify abnormal AV behaviors and escalate them through the proper channels
- Validate the performance of new and existing hardware including sensors and new vehicle platforms 
- Develop creative solutions to execute tests and improve operations
- Provide exceptional ride demonstrations to employees and guests of Cruise
- Remain well informed of all changes to vehicle behavior and tools
- Become a leader and train new operators
- Hold yourself and others accountable for maintaining our "Stay Safe" culture
- Perform special projects as requested by various Cruise teams
- Keep project details confidential 

You should apply for this role if you have the following qualifications:
- Ability to thoroughly diagnose and troubleshoot basic software issues
- Typing speed of over 50 words per minute
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Licensed to drive a motor vehicle in the U.S. for the three years immediately preceding your application and currently hold an active California driver's license
- No more than 1-point on driving record and excellent driving skills
- Clean background check and drug screen
-Must safely operate the vehicle in accordance with Cruise safety protocols and applicable law.  This includes, but is not limited to, having a sufficient range of motion to turn a steering wheel, safely operating the accelerator and brake, checking blind spots and evaluating the environment, and maintaining appropriate airbag clearance.
-Ability to tolerate physical jolts and high-speed starts, stops, turns, and maneuvers associated with driving or taking control of the autonomous vehicle in both training and daily job functions
-Capability to perform physical work including, but not limited to, bending, stooping, and various operational tasks
-Work effectively and professionally in a stressful environment, including interactions with the public
-Capacity to remain alert and extremely focused for two-hour uninterrupted blocks of time
-Must satisfy the legal requirements to become an Operator (13 CCR § 227.34)


Bonus Points:
- 3+ years previous work experience
- Bachelor's degree (or relevant QA / Operations experience)
- Prior AV experience
- Military, Content Review, Technician, EMT experience
- Defensive drivers training (Smith Systems, etc.)
- Route/Delivery experience

Perks:
- Catered lunch, snacks, etc.
- The opportunity to solve difficult problems that have immediate and valuable real-world applications
- Applied product testing in real life situations
